​​Whisper Leak: A novel side-channel attack on remote language models

AI 5 min read

The article "Whisper Leak: A Novel Side-Channel Attack on Remote Language Models" introduces a new method of exploiting vulnerabilities in remote language models through side-channel attacks. The research reveals that adversaries can extract sensitive data from these models by analyzing indirect information leaked during the model's processing tasks. This form of attack poses significant threats to data security, especially as language models are increasingly integrated into sensitive applications. EFF Teams Up With AV Comparatives to Test Android Stalkerware Detection by Major Antivirus Apps

Tech 5 min read

The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) collaborated with AV-Comparatives to assess the ability of major antivirus applications to detect Android stalkerware, malicious apps that enable unauthorized monitoring of internet users. The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of these antivirus solutions in identifying and mitigating the risks posed by stalkerware, which can compromise user privacy and security. Findings from the evaluation highlighted varying levels of detection success among different antivirus apps, underscoring the need for improved measures in recognizing and countering such threats.

CISA orders feds to patch Samsung zero-day used in spyware attacks

Tech 5 min read

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has mandated that federal agencies address a zero-day vulnerability discovered in Samsung devices, which has been exploited in spyware attacks. This directive underscores the urgency of mitigating potential security risks posed by the flaw, as it could be leveraged by malicious actors to infiltrate and compromise sensitive government systems. The order aligns with CISA's ongoing efforts to enhance the cybersecurity resilience of federal networks by ensuring that any vulnerabilities are swiftly identified and patched, thereby protecting critical infrastructure from potential
